title: Authors and Citation
text: Claire de Rosamel. Author. Alain Quartier-la-Tente. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: de Rosamel C, Quartier-la-Tente (2024). tvCoef: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models. R package version 0.2.1.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tvCoef: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models},   author = {Claire {de Rosamel} and Alain Quartier-la-Tente},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.2.1}, }

title: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models
text: goal tvCoef study time-varying coefficients models around linear regression: piecewise regressions (using strucchange detect break dates) ; local regressions (using tvReg) ; state space models (using rjd3sts).

title: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models
text: tvCoef relies rjd3sts need Java JRE 17 later version. get current stable version (latest release): get current development version GitHub: troubles installing Java, check installation manual.
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("InseeFrLab/tvCoef@*release") # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("InseeFrLab/tvCoef") # or using r-universe: install.packages('tvCoef', repos = c('https://aqlt.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))

title: Linear Time-Varying Coefficient Models
text: details methods, see associated article available https://github.com/InseeFrLab/DT-tvcoef.
code: library(tvCoef) data_gdp <- window(gdp, start = 1980, end = c(2019, 4)) reg_lin <- lm(   formula = growth_gdp ~ bc_fr_m1 + diff_bc_fr_m1,   data = data_gdp ) reg_lin #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = growth_gdp ~ bc_fr_m1 + diff_bc_fr_m1, data = data_gdp) #>  #> Coefficients: #>   (Intercept)       bc_fr_m1  diff_bc_fr_m1   #>      -1.60008        0.02047        0.04423 ssm <- ssm_lm(   reg_lin,    # To estimate the variance of the coefficient of the intercept               fixed_var_intercept = FALSE, var_intercept = 0.01,   # To estimate the variance of the explanatory variable    fixed_var_variables = FALSE, var_variables = 0.01) ssm #> Mean of time-varying estimated coefficients (smoothing):  #>   (Intercept)      bc_fr_m1 diff_bc_fr_m1         noise  #>       -1.6194        0.0207        0.0425        0.0000 summary(ssm) #> Summary of time-varying estimated coefficients (smoothing):  #>         (Intercept) bc_fr_m1 diff_bc_fr_m1      noise #> Min.         -1.791  0.02069       0.01972 -1.425e+00 #> 1st Qu.      -1.745  0.02069       0.02480 -1.997e-01 #> Median       -1.572  0.02069       0.04388  1.565e-02 #> Mean         -1.619  0.02069       0.04247  1.643e-16 #> 3rd Qu.      -1.518  0.02069       0.05731  2.243e-01 #> Max.         -1.492  0.02069       0.07697  8.114e-01

title: Pie regression — bp_lm
text: Computes many regressions breakup dates within global model

title: Pie regression — bp_lm
code: bp_lm(x, left = TRUE, break_dates, tvlm = FALSE, ...)

title: Pie regression — bp_lm
text: x lm object. global regression model. left logical. default set TRUE, .e. breakdate end date submodel break_dates optional, indicate breakup dates known. tvlm default set FALSE. Indicates model run sub data. FALSE means lm run. ... arguments passed tvReg::tvLM().

title: Pie regression — bp_lm
text: Returns element class bp_lm. list containing following elements: model computed models, class lm tvlm according parameter specified start start date time serie end end date time serie frequency frequency time serie breakdates list breakup dates left parameter specified tvlm parameter specified

title: Break data — break_data

title: French GDP — gdp
text: Dataset containing quarterly growth total gross domestic product (GDP) France quarterly series French business climate level difference.

title: French GDP — gdp
code: gdp

title: French GDP — gdp
text: quarterly ts object 1949Q2 2024Q1.

title: French GDP — gdp
text: INSEE

title: French GDP — gdp
text: Dataset containing quarterly growth total gross domestic product (GDP, "growth_gdp") France, volumes chained previous year prices, seasonally working day adjusted; French business climate level. French business climate monthly series, transformed three quarterly series using month's place quarter. example, "bc_fr_m1" contains values first month quarter, "diff_fr_m1" difference previous variable (2000Q1 value corresponds difference business climate January 2000 October 1999). Data downloaded March 15, 2024 might therefore differ latest available data.

title: Get data function — get_data
text: Retrieves data used model

title: Get data function — get_data
code: get_data(model, ...)  # S3 method for class 'lm' get_data(model, start = 1, frequency = 1, ...)  # S3 method for class 'dynlm' get_data(model, ...)  # S3 method for class 'tvlm' get_data(model, end = numeric(), frequency = 1, ...)  # S3 method for class 'bp_lm' get_data(model, ...)  # S3 method for class 'piece_reg' get_data(model, ...)

title: Get data function — get_data
text: model model ... unused parameters. start start data. frequency frequency data. end end data.

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
text: Get elements rmse_prev

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
code: get_lm_coef(model)  get_tvlm_coef(model, date, variable)  get_tvlm_bw(model)  get_rmse_bw_small(model, ...)

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
text: model result rmse_prev fonction date date want tvlm coefficients variable integer. variable want coefficients given date ... unused parameters

title: Get elements of rmse_prev — get_rmse
text: get_lm_coeff allows get coefficients linear regression prediction models get_tvlm_coeff allows get coefficients variable certain date local regression prediction models get_tvlm_bw allows get bandwidth local regression prediction models get_rmse_bw_small allows get rmse linear, local piecewise regression prediction models, bandwidth prediction model different 20. get_coeff_plot plot get_tvlm_coeff certain variable certain date, get_lm_coeff variable bandwidth prediction models, thanks get_tvlm_bw. also highlights bandwidth equal 20.

title: Hansen Table — hansen_table
text: Hansen Table

title: Hansen Table — hansen_table
code: hansen_table

title: Hansen Table — hansen_table
text: object class data.frame 20 rows 7 columns.

title: Hansen Table — hansen_table
text: Hansen, Bruce E. 1990. "Lagrange multiplier tests parameter instability non-linear models". University Rochester. https://users.ssc.wisc.edu/~bhansen/papers/LMTests.pdf.

title: Hansen Test — hansen_test
text: Performs Hansen test

title: Hansen Test — hansen_test
code: hansen_test(x, var, sigma = FALSE)

title: Hansen Test — hansen_test
text: x lm object. var variables used joint test. default variable used. sigma logical indicating joint test include variance

title: Hansen Test — hansen_test
text: Perform Hansen test, indicates variance model, global model coefficients variable within model likely unstable time. HO: coefficient/model stable time.

title: Hansen Test — hansen_test
text: Bruce E Hansen "Testing parameter instability linear models". Journal policy Modeling (1992)

title: Hansen Test — hansen_test
code: model_gdp <- lm( formula = growth_gdp ~ bc_fr_m1 + diff_bc_fr_m1, data = gdp ) hansen_test(model_gdp) #>                    L Stat Reject at 5% #> (Intercept)   0.2714 0.47        FALSE #> bc_fr_m1      0.2827 0.47        FALSE #> diff_bc_fr_m1 0.5113 0.47         TRUE #> Variance      0.3836 0.47        FALSE #> Joint Lc      1.5665 1.47         TRUE

title: Residual Effect Regression — lm_residual_effect
text: Checks residual effect model

title: Residual Effect Regression — lm_residual_effect
code: lm_residual_effect(x, var = c(-1))

title: Residual Effect Regression — lm_residual_effect
text: x lm object var variables residuals regressed. default use cancel explained variable

title: Residual Effect Regression — lm_residual_effect
code: data("AirPassengers") model <- lm(AirPassengers ~ time(AirPassengers)) lm_residual_effect(model) #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = resid(x) ~ ., data = as.data.frame(x$model[, var])) #>  #> Coefficients: #>      (Intercept)  `x$model[, var]`   #>        8.013e-13        -4.096e-16   #>

title: Business Surveys — manufacturing
text: Dataset containing quarterly growth production manufacturing sector main sub-sectors, quarterly balance opinion business surveys published INSEE Banque de France quarterly overhang industrial production index.

title: Business Surveys — manufacturing
code: manufacturing

title: Business Surveys — manufacturing
text: quarterly ts object 1949Q2 2024Q1.

title: Business Surveys — manufacturing
text: INSEE, Banque de France

title: Business Surveys — manufacturing
text: Dataset containing quarterly growth production manufacturing sector main sub-sectors quarterly series series business surveys published INSEE Banque de France. sectors studied : Manufacturing industry Food products beverages (C1) Capital goods (C3) Transport equipments (C4) manufacturing (C5) "manuf_prod" contains quarterly growth production manufacturing sector, sub-sectors form "prod_c1", "prod_c3", "prod_c4" "prod_c5". overhang industrial production index corresponds quarterly growth obtained extending series last known value: "overhang_ipi0" quarterly growth obtained extending series last value previous quarter (December, March, June, September); "overhang_ipi1" quarterly growth obtained extending series first value current quarter (January, April, July, October); "overhang_ipi2" quarterly growth obtained extending series second value current quarter (February, May, August, November). business surveys monthly, balance opinion transformed three quarterly series using month's place quarter (example taking values January, April, July October). Variable names constructed combination several codes defined follows: data source code (INSEE, ins, Banque de France, bdf); name balance opinion: sector: nothing manufacturing industri "c1", "c3", "c4" "c5" sub-sectors; place month quarter: m1, m2 m3 first, second third month quarter. dataset also contains dummies labelled "indYYYYQX", YYYY year X quarter.

what: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
text: Functions test coefficient fixed moving according Hansen test (hansen_test())

title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
code: moving_coefficients(   x,   a = c(5, 1, 2.5, 7.5, 10, 20),   sigma = FALSE,   intercept = TRUE )  fixed_coefficients(   x,   a = c(5, 1, 2.5, 7.5, 10, 20),   sigma = FALSE,   intercept = TRUE )

title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
text: x lm object. level sigma logical indicating joint test include variance intercept boolean indicating intercept consider moving coefficient least one variable moving.

title: Detect Fixed or Moving Coefficients — moving_coefficients
text: NULL variable selected, otherwise order variables.

what: Out of sample forecast (or simulated out of sample) — oos_prev
title: Out of sample forecast (or simulated out of sample) — oos_prev
text: sample forecast (simulated sample)

title: Out of sample forecast (or simulated out of sample) — oos_prev
code: oos_prev(model, date = 28, period = 1, ...)  # S3 method for class 'lm' oos_prev(model, date = 28, period = 1, data = NULL, ...)  # S3 method for class 'piece_reg' oos_prev(model, date = 28, period = 1, ...)  # S3 method for class 'tvlm' oos_prev(   model,   date = 28,   period = 1,   data_est = NULL,   fixed_bw = FALSE,   bw = NULL,   end = numeric(),   frequency = 1,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'bp_lm' oos_prev(   model,   date = 28,   period = 1,   data_est = NULL,   data,   fixed_bw = FALSE,   bw = NULL,   ... )  # S3 method for class 'piece_reg' oos_prev(model, date = 28, period = 1, ...)

title: Out of sample forecast (or simulated out of sample) — oos_prev
text: model object used select method date choose want start revision process start date. default set 28 periods. period choose many values want move forward. default set 1. ... arguments data ts object containing variables model. Necessary x formula. data_est, end, frequency optional arguments specify data used estimate model, last date frequency fixed_bw logical, default set FALSE. Indicates bandwidth computed forecast model, takes value bandwidth tvlm model. bw bandwidth local regression (tvlm = TRUE).

title: Out of sample forecast (or simulated out of sample) — oos_prev
text: oos_prev returns object class revision, models class lm tvlm. object class bplm returns forecasts residuals . object class revision list containing following elements: model models used forecast debut date chosen earlier intervalle period chosen earlier end_dates vector end date models frequency frequency data forecast forecast residuals errors forecast

title: Out of sample forecast (or simulated out of sample) — oos_prev
code: data_gdp <- window(gdp, start = 1980, end = c(2019, 4)) reg_lin <- lm(   formula = growth_gdp ~ bc_fr_m1 + diff_bc_fr_m1,   data = data_gdp ) oos <- oos_prev(reg_lin)

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: Computes one global linear regression, splitted data

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
code: piece_reg(   x,   break_dates = NULL,   fixed_var = NULL,   tvlm = FALSE,   bw = NULL,   left = TRUE,   ... )

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: x lm object. global regression model break_dates optional, indicate breakdates known. default set NULL. fixed_var fixed variables (splitted using break_dates). tvlm default set FALSE. Indicates model run sub data. FALSE means lm run. bw bandwidth local regression (tvlm = TRUE). left logical. default set TRUE, .e. breakdate end date submodel ... arguments passed tvReg::tvLM().

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: Returns element class lm

title: Piecewise regression — piece_reg
text: Computes possible breakdates filled . Uses function break_data run linear regression splitted data.

what: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
text: According parameter fixed_var, computes new explained variable, explained variable minus product estimated coefficients values fixed variables.

title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
code: resid_lm_fixed(x, fixed_var)

title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
text: x lm model fixed_var list variables vary time according hansen_test

title: Extract data frame for lm_fixed_coeff — resid_lm_fixed
text: new environment explained variable named "fixed".

title: Root mean squarred error — rmse
text: Root mean squarred error

title: Root mean squarred error — rmse
code: rmse(resid)

title: Root mean squarred error — rmse
text: resid residuals vector rmse calculated

what: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: Computes 6 models: linear regression, piecewise regression (linear regression local regression), local regression (tvLM), piecewise regression fixed coefficients tvlm fixed coefficients. Computes 6 rmse residuals 6 others residuals predictions models.

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
code: rmse_prev(x, data, fixed_var = NULL, fixed_bw = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for class 'formula' rmse_prev(x, data, fixed_var = NULL, fixed_bw = FALSE, ...)  # S3 method for class 'lm' rmse_prev(x, data, fixed_var = NULL, fixed_bw = FALSE, ...)

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: x object class formula lm, description model fitted, model . data ts object containing variables model. Necessary x formula. fixed_var variables model coefficients fixed models fixed coefficients. Obtained thanks hansen test. fixed_bw logical, default set FALSE. Indicates bandwidth computed forecast model, takes value bandwidth tvlm model. ... additional arguments

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: Returns object class prev list containing following elements: model list 6 explanatory models forecast list 6 predictions 6 previous models rmse list 2 computed rmse, sample sample

title: Computes RMSE of different models — rmse_prev
text: additional arguments, parameters date period can informed. oos_prev default respectively set 28 1. estimate forecast models, function oos_prev used. forecasts two models fixed coefficients, fixed coefficients re-estimated date, bp_lm tvLM run moving variables.

title: State space model — ssm_lm
text: Computes state space model one equation. Starting simple lm model, build state space model run . Use rjd3sts packages.

title: State space model — ssm_lm
code: ssm_lm(   x,   trend = FALSE,   var_intercept = 0,   var_slope = 0,   var_variables = 0,   fixed_var_intercept = TRUE,   fixed_var_trend = TRUE,   fixed_var_variables = TRUE,   ...,   remove_last_dummies = FALSE,   intercept = TRUE )

title: State space model — ssm_lm
text: x lm dynlm model trend boolean indicating model trend. var_intercept, var_slope variance intercept (used ìntercept = TRUE) slope (used trend = TRUE). var_variables variance variables: can either single value (variance variables) vector specifying variance. fixed_var_intercept, fixed_var_trend, fixed_var_variables logical indicating variance fixed estimated. ... arguments used rjd3sts::estimate(). remove_last_dummies boolean indicating current dummies (.e.: 0 1 last date) removed. intercept boolean indicating model intercept.

title: State space model — ssm_lm
text: Returns list containing: smoothed_states \(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_n]\) smoothed_stdev \(\sqrt{V[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_n]}\) filtering_states \(E[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_{t-1}]\) filtering_stdev \(\sqrt{V[a_t|y_0,\dots,y_{t-1}]}\) parameters estimation parameters data data used original model

title: State space model — ssm_lm
code: data_gdp <- window(gdp, start = 1980, end = c(2019, 4)) reg_lin <- lm(   formula = growth_gdp ~ bc_fr_m1 + diff_bc_fr_m1,   data = data_gdp ) ssm <- ssm_lm(reg_lin, fixed_var_intercept = FALSE, fixed_var_variables = FALSE) ssm #> Mean of time-varying estimated coefficients (smoothing):  #>   (Intercept)      bc_fr_m1 diff_bc_fr_m1         noise  #>       -1.5964        0.0205        0.0425        0.0000  summary(ssm) #> Summary of time-varying estimated coefficients (smoothing):  #>         (Intercept) bc_fr_m1 diff_bc_fr_m1      noise #> Min.         -1.596  0.01877       0.01990 -1.426e+00 #> 1st Qu.      -1.596  0.01920       0.02492 -1.953e-01 #> Median       -1.596  0.02094       0.04371  1.087e-02 #> Mean         -1.596  0.02046       0.04252 -1.605e-17 #> 3rd Qu.      -1.596  0.02147       0.05741  2.240e-01 #> Max.         -1.596  0.02174       0.07843  7.934e-01

what: Out of sample forecast of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
title: Out of sample forecast of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
text: Computes sample forecasts given state space model. Unlike ssm_lm can manage dummies.

title: Out of sample forecast of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
code: ssm_lm_oos(   x,   trend = FALSE,   var_intercept = 0,   var_slope = 0,   var_variables = 0,   fixed_var_intercept = TRUE,   fixed_var_trend = TRUE,   fixed_var_variables = TRUE,   date = 28,   ... )

title: Out of sample forecast of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
text: x lm dynlm model trend boolean indicating model trend. var_intercept, var_slope variance intercept (used ìntercept = TRUE) slope (used trend = TRUE). var_variables variance variables: can either single value (variance variables) vector specifying variance. fixed_var_intercept, fixed_var_trend, fixed_var_variables logical indicating variance fixed estimated. date choose want start revision process start date. default set 28 periods. ... arguments used rjd3sts::estimate().

title: Out of sample forecast of state space model — ssm_lm_oos
text: Returns coefficients variables residual

title: tvCoef 0.2.1
text: deprecated functions removed. correction bp_lm() use intercept. correction use bp_lm() rmse_prev.

title: tvCoef 0.2.0
text: function get_coeff_plot() removed avoid using ggplot2 patchwork. doc improvements. prevision attribute (example oos_prev()) renamed forecast. renaming exported S3 classes : "bp.lms", "piecereg" "hansen.test" "bp_lms", "piecereg" "hansen_test" respectively.
